column4: Question...  I seem to have some form of connection problem, for instance it takes firefox 10 seconds to look up www.google.com not load the page the actual time it takes to look up the page
And when I ping a website using the network assist it locks up intermittently
how long does it take when you use nslookup www.google.com ?
what nameserver are you using?
paste /etc/resolve.conf
perhaps you could enter the *put your provider here* nameserver for lookup
or simple wait
restart your router could be a solution
Nope didn't help

I'm back after resetting the router still having the same problem and confirmed it is a problem with the network or internet because firefox responded very quickly when accessing the pages for my router settings
so welcome back. so you could enter a temporary faster nameserver in resolv.conf
if I wanted to do that I would need to reset my modem, but I'm pretty sure that isn't the problem
whY that?
I just checked, my sister who is running an older version of Ubuntu doesn't have this problem
mmh, strange
sorry, i cannot help you any further. perhaps others are more familiar with that ;)
what do you mean?
have a look at /boot/grub/menu.lst
are you familiar with that?
pastebin?
pastebin?
sorry ;) can you simple copy/paste the contents of menu.lst?
